content: v2 13/03/2019 the yarnivore uk free pattern dragon scale gloves adult size intermediate pattern materials needed  yarn dk/ light worsted between 50-100g per pair depending on gauge length and fibre of yarn  3 5mm hook  scissors  yarn needle notes  us terminology used throughout  i find variegated yarn work best personally i like cygnet boho king cole riot and drops delight  starting chain is multiples of 6  take care not to twist the starting chain when joining  glove is worked in the round joining at the end of each row  be sure to keep trying your glove on to make sure it fits special stitches used  v_stitch 2 double_crochet in the same stitch  crocodile stitch 5 double_crochet chain 1 5 double_crochet around posts of v- stitch there is a very helpful tutorial here from bhooked https //www youtube com/watch v=6brkefpiymk stitch abbreviations  double_crochet - double_crochet  cs crocodile stitch  slip_stitch slip_stitch  chain chain  fpdc front post double_crochet  bpdc back post double_crochet © the yarnivore uk 2019 http //www yarnivore co uk no unauthorised reproduction in whole or in part or distribution of this pattern or content is allowed this pattern is the property of holly fisher the sole proprietor of the yarnivore uk v2 13/03/2019 pattern chain 36 slip_stitch to beginning chain to make a large ring be sure not to twist the chain starting chain is multiples of 6 this makes a medium size glove row 1 chain 3 double_crochet in the same stitch chain 1 skip 2 chains 1 double_crochet in the next ch1 skip 2 chains *2 double_crochet in the next v_stitch made ch1 sk2 1 double_crochet ch1 sk2* continue from * to * around slip_stitch to top of beginning ch3 6 v_stitch 6 double_crochet r2 starting crocodile stitch chain 3 double_crochet 4 around the post of the chain 3 from the previous round working in a downwards direction chain 1 double_crochet 5 around the post of the next double_crochet in the v_stitch from the previous row going back up crocodile stitch made slip stitch into next double_crochet *crocodile stitch around next v_stitch 5dc ch1 5dc slip_stitch in double_crochet* repeat around 6 crocodile stitch 6 slip_stitch note on the final slip_stitch i like to slip through the beginning chain 3 from the first crocodile stitch and the double_crochet to anchor it to the round r3 chain 3 double_crochet in the same stitch chain 1 *double_crochet in the middle of the crocodile stitch between the two sides of the scale chain 1 v_stitch in the slip_stitch ch1* repeat from * to * around slip_stitch to top of chain 3 6 v_stitch 6 double_crochet r4 repeat row 2 crocodile stitch row r5 repeat row 3 foundation stitch row r6 repeat r2 cs row r7 repeat r3 r8 repeat r2 cs row r9 repeat r3 r10 repeat r2 cs row r11 repeat r3 r12 repeat r2 cs row -you should now have 6 row
